channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipping, 14th June
item.description:
This area is constantly being fly tipping around here. This is because the flats above the shops have no bins & just throw it in sacks as they like.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Springfield Road, Welling, London

item.title: Man dumping bagged waste at the recycling centre on Boston Place, 14th June
item.description:
I have just witnessed a man empting his car of multiple rubbish bags at the recycling centre on Boston Place he also placed a large garden waste bag in the plastic recycling bin. Please carry out enforcement you have his car number plate.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 106, Boston Place, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned barriers and signage blocking e-cycle parking, 14th June
item.description:
Nearby roadworks were completed weeks ago. The contractors left behind cones, signage, plastic barriers, taking up the entirety of the on-street cycle parking.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-12, Peckham Rye, East Dulwich, London

item.title: Play surface extremely worn, 14th June
item.description:
The play area tarmac is rough and uneven and it is difficult to play on. It clearly has been neglected for some time, and needs resurfacing so the children can play here.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Warepoint Drive, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly Tip Residential Road, 14th June
item.description:
I am writing to formally address the ongoing issue of fly-tipping along [road name]. There are two specific areas where rubbish and random items have been dumped over the fence on the right-hand side as you drive up the road. Most notably, a fridge has been abandoned near a ground-floor balcony, where it has remained for several weeks. This situation is not only unsightly but also poses a potential risk to both the environment and public health. As a resident, the current state of the area is unacceptable, and it significantly detracts from the quality of life. I urge you to take immediate action to remove these items. It is essential that this matter is addressed promptly to restore the area and ensure it remains safe and presentable for all who live here. I trust that you will prioritize this matter and look forward to seeing the necessary steps taken without further delay.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dunkery Road, Mottingham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing litter bin near bus stop A SevenOaks Way, 14th June
item.description:
This small litter bin attached to lamppost is full and overflowing again as it was a week ago. Have reported several times. Would benefit from another bin sited on the next lamppost and/or one at the bus stop.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 168, Sevenoaks Way, St Paul's Cray, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fence in kids playground falling down, 14th June

item.title: Dumped waste, 14th June
item.description:
I’m flagging this because the current state of the woods is completely unacceptable. There is random rubbish dumped everywhere, and it’s beyond just a few items—this is a widespread mess that needs urgent attention. The area needs a proper walk-through. It’s not a huge space, but it’s been clearly neglected. The amount of waste is not only disgusting but also unsafe for the environment, the local wildlife, and for people and dogs using the area. I strongly suggest someone takes a proper walk through the site—you’ll see exactly what I’m talking about. This needs to be addressed now, not pushed down the line before it gets worse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dunkery Road, Mottingham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Both ends of Murray Mews, 14th June
item.description:
The “no vehicles except for access” signs at each of Murray Mews frequently cause issues with taxi and delivery drivers refusing to drive to addresses in the street. Please add clarification that access to properties in the street is permitted so that this does not occur.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Murray Mews, Kentish Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet
